overview: From 2026-01-01 to 2026-02-01, elizaos/elizaos.github.io had 32 new PRs (17 merged), 12 new issues, and 8 active contributors.

topIssues.title: fix: Overall summaries not generated for days with no repository activity
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Problem

Overall summary API endpoints return 404 for dates with no repository activity:
- `/api/summaries/overall/day/2026-01-01.json` ‚Üí 404 ‚ùå
- `/api/summaries/overall/day/2026-01-02.json` ‚Üí 200 ‚úÖ

## Expected Behavior

The API should return a summary for **every day the pipeline runs**, even if there's no activity:

```json
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "type": "overall",
  "interval": "day",
  "date": "2026-01-01",
  "generatedAt": "2026-01-02T00:00:00.000Z",
  "contentFormat": "markdown",
  "content": "No activity recorded for January 1, 2026."
}
```

## Root Cause

[`generateOverallSummaryForInterval()`](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaos.github.io/blob/main/src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateOverallSummary.ts#L70-L76) returns `null` when no repository summaries exist:

```typescript
const repoSummaries = await getAllRepoSummariesForInterval(interval);
if (repoSummaries.length === 0) {
  intervalLogger?.debug(
    `No repository summaries found for ${intervalType} of ${startDate}, skipping overall summary generation.`,
  );
  return null; // ‚Üê This causes the 404
}
```

## Evidence

```bash
# Jan 1 had ZERO activity (New Year's Day)
$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM raw_pull_requests WHERE DATE(created_at) = '2026-01-01';"
0

$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM raw_issues WHERE DATE(created_at) = '2026-01-01';"
0

# Database has monthly summary but NO daily summary
$ sqlite3 data/db.sqlite "SELECT date, interval_type, LENGTH(summary) FROM overall_summaries WHERE date = '2026-01-01';"
2026-01-01|month|4320
```

## Solution

Always generate a summary, even when `repoSummaries.length === 0`:

```typescript
const repoSummaries = await getAllRepoSummariesForInterval(interval);

// Generate summary even if no repo summaries exist
const summary = repoSummaries.length > 0
  ? await generateOverallSummary(
      repoSummaries,
      aiSummaryConfig,
      { startDate },
      intervalType as RepoIntervalType,
    )
  : `No activity recorded for ${intervalType} of ${startDate}.`;

if (\!summary) {
  intervalLogger?.debug(
    `Overall summary generation resulted in no content for ${startDate}, skipping storage.`,
  );
  return;
}

// Store and export the summary...
```

## Impact

- API consumers can't distinguish between "no data" and "endpoint not generated"
- 404s break API contract that promises daily summaries
- Inconsistent API behavior (some days exist, others don't)
- Downstream tools must handle unexpected 404s

## Design Philosophy

Per the API documentation:
> "404 responses indicate artifacts not yet published."

But this should mean "pipeline hasn't run yet", NOT "no activity that day". If the pipeline runs daily, every day should have a summary‚Äîeven if it says "no activity."

## References

- API Documentation: https://elizaos.github.io/api
- Generation code: `src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateOverallSummary.ts:70-76`
- OpenAPI spec: https://elizaos.github.io/openapi.json

topIssues.title: fix: API index and contributor profiles not exported due to missing SITE_URL in run-pipelines workflow
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Problem

The following API endpoints return 404 on production:
- `/api/index.json`
- `/api/contributors/{username}/profile.json` (all 1,433 contributor profiles)

Meanwhile, these endpoints work fine:
- `/api/leaderboard-*.json` ‚úÖ
- `/api/summaries/**` ‚úÖ

## Root Cause

The `run-pipelines.yml` workflow doesn't set the `SITE_URL` environment variable when running `bun run pipeline export-leaderboard`.

Without `SITE_URL`, the following functions skip exporting:
- [`exportAPIIndex()`](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaos.github.io/blob/main/src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts#L1180-L1184) - skips with warning "SITE_URL not configured"
- [`exportAllUserProfiles()`](https://github.com/elizaOS/elizaos.github.io/blob/main/src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts#L1078-L1081) - skips with info "Skipping user profiles: SITE_URL not configured"

The files ARE generated locally during `deploy.yml` build (12MB of contributor profiles), but they're generated too late‚Äîafter the pipelines have already run.

## Evidence

```bash
# Files exist locally after build
$ ls -lh out/api/
drwxr-xr-x 1435 jin jin   36M contributors/  # ‚Üê 404 on production
-rw-r--r--    1 jin jin  4.0K index.json      # ‚Üê 404 on production
-rw-r--r--    1 jin jin  2.6M leaderboard-lifetime.json  # ‚úÖ works
-rw-r--r--    1 jin jin   34K leaderboard-monthly.json   # ‚úÖ works
drwxr-xr-x    5 jin jin  4.0K summaries/      # ‚úÖ works
```

```bash
# Production only has these
$ curl -s https://elizaos.github.io/api/ | grep href
href="summaries/"
href="leaderboard-lifetime.json"
href="leaderboard-monthly.json"
href="leaderboard-weekly.json"
```

## Solution

Add SITE_URL to `run-pipelines.yml` env section:

```yaml
env:
  GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
  OPENROUTER_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENROUTER_API_KEY }}
  PIPELINE_DATA_BRANCH: "_data"
  DATA_DIR: "data"
  SITE_URL: ${{ secrets.SITE_URL || 'https://elizaos.github.io' }}  # ‚Üê Add this
  PIPELINE_CONFIG_FILE: ${{ secrets.PIPELINE_CONFIG_FILE || 'config/example.json' }}
```

Or detect it dynamically like `deploy.yml` does:
```yaml
- name: Determine site URL
  id: site-config
  run: |
    if [[ "${{ github.event.repository.name }}" == *.github.io ]]; then
      echo "site_url=https://${{ github.repository_owner }}.github.io" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    fi
```

## Impact

- 12MB of contributor profile data not accessible via API
- API discovery endpoint (`/api/index.json`) returns 404
- Third-party tools can't discover API capabilities
- Documentation references broken endpoints

## References

- API Documentation: https://elizaos.github.io/api
- OpenAPI Spec: https://elizaos.github.io/openapi.json
- Export code: `src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts`

topIssues.title: feat: extend grouped org/repo format to day/week/month summaries
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

PR #193 introduced grouped org/repo format for lifetime summaries to improve readability for contributors with many PRs across multiple repositories.

This issue proposes extending the same format to day/week/month summaries for consistency.

## Current State (verified from code)

**Lifetime summaries** (new format):
```
PULL REQUESTS:
- Merged: 3 PRs:
  - elizaos/eliza (3 PRs): #6197 "fix markdown spacing" (+10/-5), #6202 "migrate SQL plugin" (+50/-10), #6209 "parallel action" (+200/-50)
```

**Day/week/month summaries** (old format with redundant repo names):
```
PULL REQUESTS:
- Merged: 3 PRs: elizaos/eliza#6197 "fix markdown spacing" (+10/-5 lines), elizaos/eliza#6202 "migrate SQL plugin" (+50/-10 lines), elizaos/eliza#6209 "parallel action" (+200/-50 lines)
```

The repo name `elizaos/eliza` is repeated for every PR. This is verified from `aiContributorSummary.ts` line 153:
```typescript
return `${pr.repository}#${pr.number} ...`;
```

## Proposed Change

Apply the same grouped format to all intervals to eliminate redundancy.

## Benefits

1. **Eliminates redundancy** - Repo name appears once per repo, not per PR
2. **Consistency** - Same format across all summary types  
3. **Clearer repo distribution** - AI can see at a glance where work is concentrated
4. **Token efficiency** - Fewer tokens wasted on repeated org/repo strings

## Implementation

Modify `formatContributorPrompt()` in `src/lib/pipelines/summarize/aiContributorSummary.ts`:
- Remove the `intervalType === "lifetime"` condition
- Apply grouped format unconditionally

## Testing

- Generate summaries for various intervals and contributor activity levels
- Verify AI output quality is maintained or improved

topIssues.title: feat: Make character class thresholds configurable
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

Move character class thresholds from hardcoded values to `config/example.json` for per-deployment customization.

## Current State

Thresholds are hardcoded in `src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts`:

```typescript
const types = [
  { key: "prs", name: "Builder", threshold: 50 },
  { key: "issues", name: "Hunter", threshold: 25 },
];
const hasHighReviews = distribution.reviews.percentage >= 25;
```

## Proposed Config

```json
{
  "characterSystem": {
    "thresholds": {
      "builder": { "prs": 50 },
      "hunter": { "issues": 25 },
      "maintainer": { "reviews": 25 },
      "scribe": { "docsFocus": 40 }
    },
    "tiers": {
      "beginner": 0,
      "regular": 50,
      "active": 200,
      "veteran": 500,
      "elite": 1000,
      "legend": 5000
    }
  }
}
```

## Benefits

- Fork-friendly: Different orgs have different contribution patterns
- PM-friendly: No code changes to tune thresholds
- Consistent with existing config patterns (scoring rules, bot exclusions)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Add characterSystem section to config schema
- [ ] Load thresholds from config in deriveCharacterClass()
- [ ] Update documentation
- [ ] Add example config values

## Related

- PR #193 added documentation noting this as future work

topIssues.title: feat: Allow class respec with history preservation
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

Allow users to change their class while preserving history for lore.

## Rules

- Respec has a cooldown period (e.g., once per month)
- Previous class is recorded in history
- Lore displays journey: "Once a Builder, now walks the Scribe path"
- Only can respec to classes you qualify for based on activity

## API

```
POST /api/users/{username}/respec
{
  "targetClass": "Scribe"
}
```

Returns error if:
- Cooldown not met
- User doesn't qualify for target class

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Respec endpoint with cooldown check
- [ ] Qualification validation for target class
- [ ] History recording on respec
- [ ] UI for respec on profile page

## Related

- Depends on #194 (Orders & Evolution system)
- Depends on lore recording (#196)

topPRs.title: Consolidate untracked repos pipeline and fix DRY violations
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
## Problem

Users have no visibility into repositories in their organizations that aren't being tracked for contributor analytics. With 35 tracked repos but 286 total repos across `elizaos` and `elizaos-plugins` orgs, there's a lot of "dark matter" - repos that exist but aren't on the radar.

## Solution

Adds **untracked repository discovery** feature that:

- Discovers all repos in configured organizations
- Shows basic stats: stars, forks, recent PR/issue activity
- Calculates activity scores to surface active repos
- Helps identify which repos might be worth adding to full tracking
- Provides 360-degree view of org activity

**UI:** New collapsible section on `/repos` page showing untracked repos with:
- Repository metadata (description, language, stars)
- Recent activity counts (PRs, issues in last 30 days)
- Activity score ranking
- Links to GitHub

**Pipeline:** `bun run pipeline ingest-untracked`
- Delta detection: only updates repos with changes
- Efficient batch operations
- Configurable org list and exclusion patterns

## Configuration

```json
{
  "PIPELINE_UNTRACKED_REPOS": {
    "enabled": true,
    "organizations": ["elizaos", "elizaos-plugins"],
    "excludeArchived": true,
    "excludePatterns": ["deprecated-*", "test-*"]
  }
}
```

## Implementation

Single-file pipeline (`discoverUntrackedRepos.ts`) using:
- Log-scale activity scoring (prevents big repos from dominating)
- Delta detection via `lastUpdatedAt` (skips unchanged repos)
- Batch database operations
- Existing codebase patterns and utilities

Closes #230


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

* **New Features**
  * Added untracked repository discovery to identify repositories from configured GitHub organizations not currently in the system
  * New UI section displaying discovered untracked repositories with activity metrics, stats, and recent activity breakdown
  * Repository stats button showing tracked vs untracked counts with quick navigation to untracked section
  * Manual trigger option for discovering untracked repositories via workflow dispatch

* **Chores**
  * Added database storage for untracked repository data and metadata

<sub>‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

topPRs.title: feat: add MMORPG-style character system to leaderboard API
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
Enhance leaderboard API with comprehensive character progression system inspired by Ragnarok Online: ## Phase 1: Enhanced Focus Areas with Rankings - Transform focus areas from simple tags to rich objects with scores, percentages, and global rankings - Add FocusAreaDetail interface with tag, score, percentage, rank, and totalInArea - Calculate global rankings across all contributors per focus area - Show expertise distribution (e.g., "#3 in Frontend out of 45 contributors") ## Phase 2: Lifetime Summary Endpoint - Add /api/summaries/contributors/{username}/lifetime.json endpoint for all-time summaries - Update schema to support "lifetime" interval type in user_summaries table - Create database migration (0014_add_lifetime_interval.sql) - Add --lifetime CLI flag for opt-in generation - Implement generateLifetimeSummary pipeline with all-time metrics ## Phase 3: MMORPG Character Sheet Score Breakdown - Add ScoreBreakdown interface with tier, percentile, characterClass, and distribution - Implement 6-tier progression system: beginner ‚Üí regular ‚Üí active ‚Üí veteran ‚Üí elite ‚Üí legend - Calculate percentile rankings showing relative standing among all contributors - Auto-derive character classes from behavior patterns: * Author (PRs ‚â•50%), Reviewer (Reviews ‚â•30%), Advocate (Issues ‚â•25%), Discussant (Comments ‚â•20%) * Hybrid classes: Maintainer (Author + Reviewer), and dynamic combinations - Show contribution distribution as percentages (Code Author, Problem Finder, Code Reviewer, Discussant) ## Phase 4: User Profile Endpoint - Add /api/contributors/{username}/profile.json endpoint - Query complete character sheet for any user by username - Include ranks across all time periods (monthly, weekly, lifetime) - Provide links to all summaries and resources - Much faster than downloading entire leaderboard ## Technical Changes - Update OpenAPI spec with new endpoints and schemas - Add comprehensive API documentation with example responses - Update CLI to support lifetime interval generation - Export individual user profiles during leaderboard generation - Add .gitignore entry for docs/ folder

Greptile Overview

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR implements a comprehensive MMORPG-inspired character progression system for the leaderboard API, adding lifetime summaries, enhanced focus areas with rankings, score breakdowns with tiers and percentiles, character classes, and individual user profile endpoints. ## Key Changes **Phase 1 - Lifetime Summaries**: Added database support and pipeline logic for all-time contributor summaries via new `lifetime` interval type. Contributors can opt-in via `--lifetime` CLI flag. Summaries are stored at simplified paths (`/api/summaries/contributors/{username}/lifetime.json`). **Phase 2 - Enhanced Focus Areas**: Transformed simple tags into rich objects with scores, percentages, and global rankings. Each contributor now shows their rank within each expertise area (e.g., "#3 in Frontend out of 45 contributors"). **Phase 3 - MMORPG Character System**: Added comprehensive score breakdowns with: - 6-tier progression (beginner ‚Üí legend) - Percentile rankings among all contributors - Auto-derived character classes based on behavior (Author, Reviewer, Maintainer, etc.) - Contribution distribution as percentages **Phase 4 - User Profiles**: New `/api/contributors/{username}/profile.json` endpoint providing complete character sheets with ranks across all time periods, focus areas, achievements, and links to related resources. ## Architecture The implementation follows existing pipeline patterns, extending the summarize and export stages. Database schema properly migrated to support lifetime interval. All enrichment data is fetched in batches and mapped efficiently. Profile generation reuses leaderboard data to avoid duplicate queries. ## Issues Found - **[P0] Critical**: `.gitignore` syntax error prevents `docs/` from being ignored correctly - **[P1] Urgent**: Logic bug in contributor type classification makes "reviewer" type unreachable ### Confidence Score: 3/5 - Not safe to merge without fixes - contains one critical syntax error and one logic bug affecting core functionality - The PR has two blocking issues: (1) a P0 syntax error in .gitignore that will cause the docs/ directory to not be ignored, potentially committing generated files, and (2) a P1 logic error in contributor type classification where the "reviewer" type is unreachable due to incorrect condition ordering. While the overall implementation is well-structured and follows existing patterns, these bugs affect core functionality and must be fixed before merge. - .gitignore (P0 syntax error) and src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts (P1 logic bug in contributor classification)

topPRs.title: feat: enhance API documentation with examples and improved UX
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
## Summary Comprehensive enhancement of the API documentation page to make it production-ready for AI agents and developers. ### OpenAPI Spec Improvements - ‚úÖ Added complete JSON response examples to all endpoints - ‚úÖ Added realistic 200, 404, and 400 response structures - ‚úÖ Added examples for `leaderboard-weekly` and `leaderboard-lifetime` endpoints - ‚úÖ Added examples for summary index endpoints and dated snapshots ### API Page UX Improvements - ‚úÖ Replaced accordion UI with flat, README-style layout for better scanability - ‚úÖ Added custom zero-dependency syntax highlighting (bash/JavaScript/Python) - ‚úÖ Highlight path variables (`{repoId}`, `{username}`, etc) with blue badges - ‚úÖ Added clickable section anchors with hover links for deep linking - ‚úÖ Improved clipboard copy to always include response examples (even when collapsed) - ‚úÖ Made response examples collapsible to balance visibility and clutter - ‚úÖ Added visual distinction to section headers (borders, colors) - ‚úÖ Moved action buttons (API Index, OpenAPI Spec, Copy) to header row ### Dependencies - ‚úÖ Removed unused @scalar packages from package.json ## Test plan - [x] Verify API page loads at `/api` - [x] Check all response examples are visible when expanded - [x] Test clipboard copy includes all sections (params + responses) - [x] Verify path variables are highlighted in blue - [x] Test section anchor links work (e.g. `/api#summaries`) - [x] Confirm syntax highlighting works for all code examples - [x] Check that linter passes ## Screenshots Before: Accordion-based UI with no examples After: Flat layout with syntax highlighting and complete examples ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Summary

This PR transforms the API documentation page from an accordion-based UI to a production-ready, flat README-style layout with comprehensive enhancements. The OpenAPI specification now includes realistic JSON response examples for all endpoints (200, 404, 400 responses), making it immediately useful for AI agents and developers. The React component was completely rewritten to feature custom zero-dependency syntax highlighting for bash/JavaScript/Python, collapsible response sections for better scanability, and improved clipboard functionality that captures all endpoint details including examples even when collapsed. The workflow consolidation removes the separate `generate-summaries.yml` workflow and integrates summary generation steps directly into `run-pipelines.yml`, reducing maintenance overhead and simplifying the CI/CD pipeline structure.

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - changes are primarily UI/documentation enhancements with no breaking changes - Score reflects well-structured implementation with proper React patterns, comprehensive test plan completion, and no breaking changes. Minor deduction for the complete component rewrite introducing significant new client-side code without automated tests, though the implementation follows React best practices and includes proper error handling - Pay close attention to `src/app/api/page.tsx` during manual testing to verify syntax highlighting, clipboard functionality, and collapsible sections work across browsers

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | .github/workflows/run-pipelines.yml | Added summary import and export steps to consolidate workflows, improving maintainability | | public/openapi.json | Added comprehensive examples for all endpoints with realistic 200/404/400 responses, improving API documentation | | src/app/api/page.tsx | Complete rewrite with flat README-style layout, custom syntax highlighting, collapsible responses, and improved UX |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as User Browser participant Page as API Page Component participant Spec as /openapi.json participant Syntax as CodeBlock Component participant Copy as PageCopyButton User->>Page: Navigate to /api Page->>Page: useEffect() runs Page->>Spec: fetch("/openapi.json") Spec-->>Page: Return OpenAPI spec JSON Page->>Page: Resolve $ref parameters Page->>Page: setSpec(data), setLoading(false) Page->>Page: Group endpoints by tag Page->>Page: Sort tags and endpoints loop For each tag section Page->>Page: Render section with EndpointBlock Page->>Page: renderPathWithVars() highlights {variables} alt User expands response Page->>Page: setShowResponse(true) Page->>Page: Render JSON examples end end Page->>Syntax: Render Quickstart code examples Syntax->>Syntax: highlightBash/JS/Python() Syntax-->>Page: Return highlighted JSX alt User clicks Copy Page User->>Copy: Click PageCopyButton Copy->>Copy: Query DOM for all sections Copy->>Copy: Build markdown from sections Copy->>Copy: Include all responses (even hidden) Copy->>User: navigator.clipboard.writeText() end alt User clicks endpoint Copy User->>Page: Click CopyButton on endpoint Page->>User: Copy full URL to clipboard end ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added API index discovery endpoint with comprehensive metadata and examples * Redesigned API explorer page with OpenAPI-driven interface and interactive endpoint documentation * **Chores** * Updated build scripts; refined CI/CD pipeline workflows for artifact management ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Release notes

Sourced from drizzle-orm's releases.

0.45.1

  • Fixed pg-native Pool detection in node-postgres transactions breaking in environments with forbidden require() (#5107)

0.45.0

  • Fixed pg-native Pool detection in node-postgres transactions
  • Allowed subqueries in select fields
  • Updated typo algorythm => algorithm
  • Fixed $onUpdate not handling SQL values (fixes #2388, tests implemented by L-Mario564 in #2911)
  • Fixed pg mappers not handling Date instances in bun-sql:postgresql driver responses for date, timestamp types (fixes #4493)

0.44.7

  • fix durable sqlite transaction return value #3746 - thanks @‚Äãjoaocstro

0.44.6

  • feat: add $replicas reference #4874

0.44.5

  • Fixed invalid usage of .one() in durable-sqlite session
  • Fixed spread operator related crash in sqlite blob columns
  • Better browser support for sqlite blob columns
  • Improved sqlite blob mapping

0.44.4

  • Fix wrong DrizzleQueryError export. thanks @‚Äãnathankleyn

0.44.3

  • Fixed types of $client for clients created by drizzle function
await db.$client.[...]
  • Added the updated_at column to the neon_auth.users_sync table definition.

0.44.2

  • [BUG]: Fixed type issues with joins with certain variations of tsconfig: #4535, #4457

0.44.1

  • [BUG]: Drizzle can no longer run on Durable Objects

0.44.0

Error handling

Starting from this version, we‚Äôve introduced a new DrizzleQueryError that wraps all errors from database drivers and provides a set of useful information:

  1. A proper stack trace to identify which exact Drizzle query failed
  2. The generated SQL string and its parameters
  3. The original stack trace from the driver that caused the DrizzleQueryError

Release notes

Sourced from drizzle-kit's releases.

drizzle-kit@0.31.8

Bug fixes

  • Fixed algorythm => algorithm typo.
  • Fixed external dependencies in build configuration.

  • [BUG]: Importing drizzle-kit/api fails in ESM modules

drizzle-kit@0.31.5

  • Add casing support to studio configuration and related functions

drizzle-kit@0.31.4

  • Fixed halfvec, bit and sparsevec type generation bug in drizzle-kit

drizzle-kit@0.31.3

  • Internal changes to Studio context. Added databaseName and packageName properties for Studio

drizzle-kit@0.31.2

Bug fixes

  • Fixed relations extraction to not interfere with Drizzle Studio.

drizzle-kit@0.31.1

Fixed drizzle-kit pull bugs when using Gel extensions.

Because Gel extensions create schema names containing :: (for example, ext::auth), Drizzle previously handled these names incorrectly. Starting with this release, you can use Gel extensions without any problems. Here‚Äôs what you should do:

  1. Enable extensions schemas in drizzle.config.ts
import  { defineConfig } from "drizzle-kit";

export default defineConfig({
dialect: 'gel',
schemaFilter: ['ext::auth', 'public']
});

  1. Run drizzle-kit pull

  2. Done!

Features and improvements

Updates `task-master-ai` from 0.20.0 to 0.40.1
Release notes

Sourced from task-master-ai's releases.

task-master-ai@0.40.1

Patch Changes

  • #1523 fc1a79f Thanks @‚ÄãCrunchyman-ralph! - Codex cli Validate reasoning effort against model capabilities

    • Add provider-level reasoning effort validation for OpenAI models
    • Automatically cap unsupported effort levels (e.g., 'xhigh' on gpt-5.1 and gpt-5 becomes 'high')

  • #1549 98087ac Thanks @‚ÄãCrunchyman-ralph! - Improve CLI startup speed by 2x

  • #1545 a0007a3 Thanks @‚ÄãCrunchyman-ralph! - Smarter project root detection with boundary markers

    • Prevents Task Master from incorrectly detecting .taskmaster folders in your home directory when working inside a different project
    • Now stops at project boundaries (.git, package.json, lock files) instead of searching all the way up to the filesystem root
    • Adds support for monorepo markers (lerna.json, nx.json, turbo.json) and additional lock files (bun.lockb, deno.lock)

  • #1523 fc1a79f Thanks @‚ÄãCrunchyman-ralph! - Improve json schemas for ai-related commands making it more compatible with openai models

    • Fixes #1541 #1542

  • #1542 b817d6f Thanks @‚Äãmdimitrovg! - Fixed vertex-ai authentication when using service account and vertex location env variable.

    • Add -w/--watch flag to continuously monitor task changes with real-time updates

    • Add --no-header flag to hide the command header
    • Support file-based watching via fs.watch for local tasks.json

      • Relevant Files: Files to create, modify, or reference with descriptions
      • Codebase Patterns: Coding patterns and conventions to follow
      • Existing Infrastructure: Code and utilities to leverage
      • Scope Boundaries: What's in and out of scope for the task

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore major version` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency's major version (unless you unignore this specific dependency's major version or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore minor version` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency's minor version (unless you unignore this specific dependency's minor version or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore ` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency (unless you unignore this specific dependency or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot unignore ` will remove all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot unignore ` will remove the ignore condition of the specified dependency and ignore conditions

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary ## Summary This PR updates 6 dependencies in the minor-and-patch group via Dependabot: **Production Dependencies:** - `drizzle-orm`: 0.41.0 ‚Üí 0.45.1 (adds new `DrizzleQueryError` error handling) - `lucide-react`: 0.488.0 ‚Üí 0.562.0 (adds new icons, renames `fingerprint` ‚Üí `fingerprint-pattern`) **Development Dependencies:** - `drizzle-kit`: 0.30.6 ‚Üí 0.31.8 (schema generation improvements) - `prettier`: 3.5.3 ‚Üí 3.7.4 (TypeScript formatting fixes) - `prettier-plugin-tailwindcss`: 0.6.14 ‚Üí 0.7.2 (breaking: dropped import-sort support, changed config loading) - `task-master-ai`: 0.20.0 ‚Üí 0.40.1 (major feature additions, 2x faster startup) ## Critical Issue **The `bun.lock` file is missing from this PR.** This will cause CI failures because GitHub Actions workflows use `bun install --frozen-lockfile`, which requires the lockfile to match package.json exactly. The lockfile must be regenerated and committed to this PR. ## Compatibility Analysis The updates are generally backward compatible with some considerations: 1. **Drizzle ORM**: New error handling is additive and doesn't break existing code. The codebase uses drizzle-orm extensively (37 files) but doesn't use the newly fixed features like `$onUpdate`. 2. **Prettier/Tailwind Plugin**: May cause code reformatting, especially for TypeScript union types and Tailwind class ordering. The prettier-plugin-tailwindcss v0.7.x changes config loading behavior but should work fine with the existing setup. 3. **Lucide Icons**: Potential breaking change if the `fingerprint` icon is used (renamed to `fingerprint-pattern`). Manual verification needed across 34 files. 4. **Task Master**: CLI tool update with no breaking changes to command interface. ### Confidence Score: 2/5 - This PR cannot be merged as-is due to missing lockfile update which will cause CI failures - Score is 2/5 (critical issues prevent merge) because the bun.lock file was not updated alongside package.json. This will cause immediate CI failures in the pr-checks workflow which uses --frozen-lockfile flag. Additionally, there are potential formatting changes from Prettier updates and a possible breaking change with the renamed lucide-react icon that need verification. Once the lockfile is added, the score would increase to 4/5 as the dependency updates themselves are relatively safe. - package.json requires a corresponding bun.lock update. After adding the lockfile, verify that no files use the renamed 'fingerprint' icon from lucide-react, and run prettier to catch any formatting changes.

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | package.json | 3/5 | Updates 6 dependencies (drizzle-orm, lucide-react, drizzle-kit, prettier, prettier-plugin-tailwindcss, task-master-ai) with minor and patch version bumps. CRITICAL: Missing lockfile update - bun.lock not included in PR. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Developer participant Dep as Dependabot participant CI as GitHub Actions participant Bun as Bun Package Manager Note over Dep: Detects outdated dependencies Dep->>Dep: Update package.json versions Note over Dep: ‚ö†Ô∏è Missing: Update bun.lock Dep->>CI: Create PR #201 CI->>CI: Trigger pr-checks workflow CI->>Bun: bun install --frozen-lockfile Note over Bun: ‚ùå Fails: lockfile doesn't match package.json Bun-->>CI: Error: lockfile out of sync CI-->>Dev: ‚ùå Build failed Note over Dev: Required Fix: Dev->>Bun: Run: bun install Bun->>Bun: Resolve dependency tree Bun->>Bun: Update bun.lock Dev->>Dep: Commit bun.lock to PR CI->>Bun: bun install --frozen-lockfile Bun-->>CI: ‚úÖ Success CI->>CI: Run lint & typecheck CI->>CI: Run build & tests CI-->>Dev: ‚úÖ All checks pass ```

topPRs.title: feat: add XSL stylesheet for browser-rendered RSS feed + dependabot
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
- Add rss-style.xsl for human-readable RSS feed display in browsers - Add xml-stylesheet processing instruction to RSS output - Change Content-Type to application/xml for XSLT rendering support - Add dependabot.yml for automated dependency updates ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Greptile Summary

This PR enhances the RSS feed with browser-friendly rendering via XSLT and adds automated dependency management. The changes include adding an XSL stylesheet (`rss-style.xsl`) with a dark theme for human-readable RSS display, updating the RSS route to reference the stylesheet and changing the Content-Type to `application/xml` for proper XSLT rendering, and configuring Dependabot for weekly npm and GitHub Actions updates. **Key changes:** - XSL stylesheet uses safe XSLT operations with automatic XML escaping - RSS route properly escapes the stylesheet URL using existing `escapeXml()` function - Added `X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff` security header - Dependabot configured to group minor/patch updates and ignore major versions for manual review - Content-Type changed from `application/rss+xml` to `application/xml` (RSS readers parse XML regardless, as noted in comment)

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with no risk - All changes are well-implemented with proper security considerations: XML escaping is correctly applied, XSLT uses safe operations with automatic escaping, security headers are added, and the dependabot configuration follows best practices for automated dependency management - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | .github/dependabot.yml | Added dependabot configuration for npm and GitHub Actions with weekly updates, grouped minor/patch updates, and ignored major versions | | public/rss-style.xsl | Added XSL stylesheet for browser-rendered RSS feed with dark theme, uses safe XSLT operations with automatic escaping | | src/app/rss.xml/route.ts | Added xml-stylesheet processing instruction, changed Content-Type to application/xml for XSLT rendering, added X-Content-Type-Options header |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Browser participant NextJS as Next.js RSS Route participant XSL as rss-style.xsl participant Dependabot Note over Browser,XSL: RSS Feed Rendering Flow Browser->>NextJS: GET /rss.xml NextJS->>NextJS: Generate RSS XML with escapeXml() NextJS->>NextJS: Add xml-stylesheet processing instruction NextJS-->>Browser: Return XML (application/xml, X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff) Browser->>Browser: Parse xml-stylesheet instruction Browser->>XSL: Fetch /rss-style.xsl XSL-->>Browser: Return XSLT stylesheet Browser->>Browser: Apply XSLT transformation Browser->>Browser: Render styled RSS feed (dark theme) Note over Dependabot: Automated Dependency Updates Dependabot->>Dependabot: Weekly scan for npm updates Dependabot->>Dependabot: Weekly scan for GitHub Actions updates Dependabot->>Dependabot: Group minor/patch updates together Dependabot->>Dependabot: Ignore major version updates ```
